text:
John August Antonelli (April 12, 1930 – February 28, 2020) was an American professional baseball player. He played for the Boston and Milwaukee Braves, New York and San Francisco Giants, and Cleveland Indians between and. He later became a six-time National League All-Star, a two-time 20-game-winner, and the leader of the 1954 world champion Giants' pitching staff.
He batted left-handed, stood tall and weighed.
Antonelli died on February 28, 2020 in Rochester, New York of cancer, aged 89.

annotations.surface_form: New York and San Francisco Giants
